oneOf.description: --- ADMINISTRATION --- UpdateAdmins will change the admin set of the contract, must be called by an existing admin.
UpdateConfig will make changes to the site's configuration.
UpdateMarketing will make changes to the social/marketing aspects of the site.
Withdraw all or a specific amount of currently available funds.
--- SELLER-FACING --- CreateListing will create a new item to be displayed on the site.
UpdateListing will make modifications to an existing listing.
DeleteListing will remove an existing listing from the site.
UpdateOrder will update the status and the tracking info of an order.
CompleteOrder will remove an order and mark it as completed.
RefundOrder will completely cancel an order and refund the buyer.
--- BUYER-FACING --- CreateOrder will create a new order for one or more items on the site.
CancelOrder will cancel an order & refund the buyer. Can only be called when the `Received` status is active. An order cannot be refunded once it is being fulfilled.

Binary.description:
Binary is a wrapper around Vec<u8> to add base64 de/serialization with serde. It also adds some helper methods to help encode inline.

This is only needed as serde-json-{core,wasm} has a horrible encoding for Vec<u8>. See also <https://github.com/CosmWasm/cosmwasm/blob/main/docs/MESSAGE_TYPES.md>.

denom.description: Address of the CW20 contract to be used as a denom for this site

withdrawal_address.description: Address to which funds held by the contract can be withdrawn

Cw20ReceiveMsg.description: Cw20ReceiveMsg should be de/serialized under `Receive()` variant in a ExecuteMsg

copyright.description: Copyright info for the site (optional) Format: "Josef's Store 2022" The frontend will insert the © symbol

featured_listings.description: Array of featured listings (optional) These will appear at the top of the site

logo.description: URL to hosted logo for the site (optional) The frontend will fall back to a text logo based on `name`

socials.description: Array of socials (optional) See `Network` enum below for supported socials

oneOf.description: --- ADMINISTRATION --- Returns the site's configuration
Returns a list of administrators
Checks permissions of the caller on this contract
Returns the amount of tokens that can be withdrawn from the contract
Returns the amount of tokens that are locked up in active orderes

--- SITE INFO --- Returns the site's marketing info Marketing defines the style of the site It is fetched every time the site is opened, eliminating the need for the frontend to be redeployed to make changes to the styling. This includes featured items, the logo, etc...
--- USER-FACING --- Get single or all orders
Get single or all listings

denom.description: Address of the CW20 contract to be used as a denom for this site

withdrawal_address.description: Address to which funds held by the contract can be withdrawn

copyright.description: Copyright info for the site (optional) Format: "Josef's Store 2022" The frontend will insert the © symbol

featured_listings.description: Array of featured listings (optional) These will appear at the top of the site

logo.description: URL to hosted logo for the site (optional) The frontend will fall back to a text logo based on `name`

socials.description: Array of socials (optional) See `Network` enum below for supported socials

Addr.description:
A human readable address.

In Cosmos, this is typically bech32 encoded. But for multi-chain smart contracts no assumptions should be made other than being UTF-8 encoded and of reasonable length.

This type represents a validated address. It can be created in the following ways 1. Use `Addr::unchecked(input)` 2. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_validate(input)?` 3. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_humanize(canonical_addr)?` 4. Deserialize from JSON. This must only be done from JSON that was validated before such as a contract's state. `Addr` must not be used in messages sent by the user because this would result in unvalidated instances.

This type is immutable. If you really need to mutate it (Really? Are you sure?), create a mutable copy using `let mut mutable = Addr::to_string()` and operate on that `String` instance.

A human readable address.

In Cosmos, this is typically bech32 encoded. But for multi-chain smart contracts no assumptions should be made other than being UTF-8 encoded and of reasonable length.

This type represents a validated address. It can be created in the following ways 1. Use `Addr::unchecked(input)` 2. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_validate(input)?` 3. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_humanize(canonical_addr)?` 4. Deserialize from JSON. This must only be done from JSON that was validated before such as a contract's state. `Addr` must not be used in messages sent by the user because this would result in unvalidated instances.

This type is immutable. If you really need to mutate it (Really? Are you sure?), create a mutable copy using `let mut mutable = Addr::to_string()` and operate on that `String` instance.
